intro: Erica tetralix var. martinesii, commonly known as the Highland heath or dwarf heather, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the western regions of Europe. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is typically found in heathland and moorland habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are dark green and remain throughout the year. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
